posts.post_content: Is this really any different than any other time you've played a planeswalker, used his minus to get a beast or draw a card, or chuck a helix at someone, and then he/she immediately eats a bolt to the face?

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (4/16/2010 10:49:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He's not the greatest planeswalker but overall hes pretty good. Many people are dismissing him right off the bat. He can change your bloodghast for a 5/5 flying dragon and still get your bloodghast back. I wished they gave him a +1 or +2 counter if you revealed a land from your deck for his first ability, if this happened he would have been pretty decent. He might make his way into jund, if they get broodmate dragons and a dragon off of a sarkhan, he becomes very brutal.
  
While magic has historically made very mediocre b/r gold cards (with the exception of bituminous blast, terminate, and blightning) hes a really neat idea that definatly has its uses, i just really wished they gave him 8 counters or that +1 idea of mine.

posts.post_content: AngelxLegna clearly has no mind of his own, at pre-release decks with Sarkhan were winning more than decks with Gideon : ) Oh, and for others who are still thinking about hating on this card, think of the card advantage this gives to the already card advantage heavy Jund. Turn 5, I drop Sarkhan the Mad. I have a Thrinax on the field, I use his -2. Thrinax hits the graveyard, I got 3 1/1 Saporlings AND a 5/5 flyer out of the deal. Sarkhan the Mad is amazing, pure and simple.

posts.post_content:
I understand this card is very powerful, sac.ing your opponents creatures with mark of mutiny for dragon tokens and so on (slave of bolas doesn't hurt either), but what really bothers me is its a black/red card that only works in certain decks. Nothing wrong with that I suppose, just saying it wont see as much play. Also.. more jund coloration cards? Really? I keep hoping for white/green to make a come back..
  
   
I'm happy that at least green is getting a lot this set, I'm not a big fan of black in general.

posts.post_content:
This card has been underestimated. They actually emphasized him well with his current identity. His first ability really defines how far he's willing to go into madness in search of power and knowledge, despite the harm it will do to him. His second ability, if most of you think about it, not just it can change a few weaklings into 5/5 dragons (not to mention they can FLY), Sarkhan can make the 'mighty' Eldrazi (NOT yours, obviously) downsized, the real objective is to kill off their annihilating instincts been used against you. His ultimatum can be quite devasting if the plan is tactifully executed.
  
   
With 7 counters, you may use the 'Dragon-morphic' ability three times, and then use go for the 'MAD for knowledge' for a card since it it does not have a cost for loyalty, since it only state how much damage Sarkhan will be dealt.
  
   
Let's face it. The Eldrazi do seem great and powerful, but even they are useless if they can't be put into effect/play, or protect their owners from the l... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Well, If I ever get the cards, I'd like to make a "Sarkhan and Friends" deck.  
  
I like SorianSadaskan's idea. Use [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad) to turn an opponents creature into a dragon. Do that however many times you can afford. Play a [Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund) to gain control of their dragon(s), and voila, advantage = you.  
  
Then do whatever it takes to win. Turn yourself into a dragon to finish them off. Use [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad)'s ultimate to decimate somebody, swing with your dragon's, Whatever! JUST GO CRAZY! BWAHAHAHAHAHA--FIRE! FLY FORTH MY BEAUTIFUL DRAGONS! AAHAHAHAHAHAHA!--BURN! DESTROY! DECIMATE!

Posted By: LeoKula (4/15/2010 10:13:33 AM)

posts.post_content:
Sarkhan is seriously misrated. I play three in a discard (wierd, I know) but he fixes one of the main problems, my ability to attack, say with a [Hypnotic Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hypnotic Specter) which happens to be my only creature. Now, I need only to attack, blow up my specter, and replace him with an untapped, relatively large creature.
  
   
Also, he works wonders with [Demigod of Revenge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demigod of Revenge), a$$uming you have two. Play one, smack for 5, destroy for a dragon. Next turn, play the second Demigod, swing with both Demigods and dragon for 15, then use Sarkhans' final to smack for 5 more.
posts.html:

Posted By: Rumblin-Slumm (4/27/2010 5:05:52 PM)

posts.post_content:
I opened my first ever pack of Rise of the Eldrazi and found this guy in it. He was also the first Planeswalker me or any of my friends ever got, and the first mythic rare I ever got from a booster pack (most of my good cards I bought as singles). Needless to say I was excited.  
  
Anyway, Sarkhan the Crazy is not the bomb many of his friends are, but I would say he's still somewhat above what you can expect to get for 3BR on average. Under the \*\*\*umption that your deck is 40% lands, he can draw you 12 cards on average if your deck has a non-land average CMC of 1, 6 cards if it's 2, 4 cards if it's 3 or 3 cards if it's 4. That is, of course, \*\*\*uming you don't use any of his other abilities or he doesn't get attacked, but if that's the case then he also ate some attacks for you. Adding his other abilities into the mix, and he gets a lot better. His -4 ability is pretty weak unless you play it to end the game, you have a dedicated dragon deck or you use multiple copies of him (not li... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: blindthrall (4/27/2010 1:14:57 AM)
Rating:

I honestly think this is extremely underrated right now, and Gideon Jura is overrated simply because control players are starved to hell. I'm not going to go into magical christmasland with dream scenarios about 20 dragons in play and you use Sarkhan the Mad's final, but he's very useful for taking out Eldrazi and certain 5/5 flying lifelinking first striking angels. At this week's FNM, my opponent was on the play and on his turn 5 he sacced all his spawn tokens and made a Spawnsire of Ulamog.. On my turn I dropped Sarkhan the Mad and converted it into a 5/5 dragon. Needless to say, he was ***ed. Very useful utility card, and I expect him to see a lot of play.


@TheWrathofShane,

Nissa can only be used in Elf decks, Sarkhan 1.0 can only be used well in aggro decks, Jace 1 and 2 can only be used well in control decks, Gideon can only be used well in control\midrange decks, Ajani and Elspeth are only "r... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Running him with [Sarkhan Vol](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan Vol) seems like fun though. Protect [Sarkhan Vol](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan Vol) enough to use his ultimate (killing him by removing 6 tokens), then by playing [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad) and using his -4 ability. 20 damage in your opponent's face.  
  
Plus card draw for free and having something else other than yourself take damage ain't too shabby either. People just see this card and think "OMG HE KILLS HIMSELF THAT'S DUMB." But they don't really think about what he's capable of.

Posted By: NeoSin (4/21/2010 12:40:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Red/green deck with a BoPs and some mana conversion with 4x [Dragonmaster Outcast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragonmaster Outcast) could work wonders for Sarky here.  
  
Use [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow)s to get lands out there much faster so your Outcasts can start producing 5/5 dragons.  
  
Any time after that, drop StM here for an instant win with his ultimate. Include any number of dragon/direct damage spells to make it easier. Odds are, you've done damage to the opponent at this point so you wouldn't even need to wait until you had 4 tokens out.  
  
Or you could always go with [Conspiracy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conspiracy) and make everything you control into a dragon...
posts.html:
Red/green deck with a BoPs and some mana conversion with 4x Dragonmaster Outcast could work wonders for Sarky here.

Use Harrows to get lands out there much faster so your Outcasts can start producing 5/5 dragons.

Any time after that, drop StM here for an instant win with his ultimate. Include any number of dragon/direct damage spells to make it easier. Odds are, you've done damage to the opponent at this point so you wouldn't even need to wait until you had 4 tokens out.

Or you could always go with Conspiracy and make everything you control into a dragon...
